bodyweightSquats.description: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width; lower by bending at hips, knees and ankles, stopping when thighs are about parallel to the floor.

superman.title: Superman
superman.description: Lie prone with arms and legs extended; simultaneously lift arms, chest and legs off the floor, squeezing glute and back muscles.

upperBodyStrength.description: Targeted upper body strengthening focusing on chest, shoulders, triceps, and core stability.

listDescription.0: Push-ups for chest and shoulder strength

pushUps.description: Excellent compound movement targeting chest, shoulders and triceps. Keep elbows at ~45° to torso to prevent shoulder pain.

tricepDips.title: Tricep Dips
tricepDips.description: Sit on a stable chair or bench with hands by hips. Lower body by bending elbows to about 90°, keep shoulders depressed.

video.description: Learn proper dip technique to avoid shoulder discomfort

plankShoulderTaps.title: Plank Shoulder Taps
plankShoulderTaps.description: Start in high plank, tap opposite hand to shoulder without rocking hips. Maintains stable core and builds anti-rotation strength.

video.title: Plank Shoulder Taps Guide

plank.title: Plank
plank.description: Hold a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders, engage core, and maintain a straight line from head to heels.

superman.title: Superman
superman.description: Strengthens posterior chain muscles often neglected in upper-body training. Essential for balanced muscle development.
